Package cs151Project.views

Class Game

java.lang.Object
java.awt.Component
java.awt.Canvas
cs151Project.views.Game
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Runnable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class Game
extends java.awt.Canvas
implements java.lang.Runnable
An object of the Game class will create the game application window combining all the information about characters (entities) and level constructs (tiles). This class contains the information to start (run) the game.
See Also:
Serialized Form

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    static int getFrameWidth()
    Accessor method that returns the game application window width.
    void init()
    When the game starts, all of these actions will be performed.
    void render()
    This function is called to load all of the game graphics.
    void run()
    While the game is running, all of these actions will be performed.
    void start()
    This function allows the program to remain running until the user closes the window, loses all lives, or completes the level.
    void stop()
    This function discontinues all game sprites and functionality.
    void update()
    This function handles all the responses when the user interacts with Kirby and when Kirby interacts with other Entities and Tiles.

    • lives

      public static int lives
      The number of lives assigned to Kirby.

    • deathScreenTime

      public static int deathScreenTime
      The number of seconds that that the dying animation appears before game over. In our case, this is zero because the number of lives screen or the game over screen will appear immediately after Kirby dies.

    • showDeathScreen

      public static boolean showDeathScreen
      When the showDeathScreen variable is true, the game screen will change to the death screen.
